loonR 0.2.15
  • Reference

    Randomly place the sample within group

    Source: R/Common.R
    randomOrderWithinGroup.Rd

    Randomly place the sample within group

    randomOrderWithinGroup(group = NULL, ids = NULL, seed = 666)

    Arguments

    group

    Group label

    ids

    Sample names

    seed

    Default 666

    Value

    Examples

    group = rep(c("G1","G2"),c(10,10))
ids = 1:20
loonR::randomOrderWithinGroup(group, ids)
#> # A tibble: 20 × 2
#> # Groups:   Group [2]
#>    Group Order
#>    <chr> <int>
#>  1 G1        5
#>  2 G1        9
#>  3 G1        4
#>  4 G1        1
#>  5 G1        2
#>  6 G1        3
#>  7 G1        7
#>  8 G1        8
#>  9 G1       10
#> 10 G1        6
#> 11 G2       13
#> 12 G2       16
#> 13 G2       18
#> 14 G2       17
#> 15 G2       12
#> 16 G2       11
#> 17 G2       19
#> 18 G2       14
#> 19 G2       15
#> 20 G2       20
